result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricky J. Wood

defendant.name: Wood, Ricky J.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on October 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:35 PM Defendant Ricky J. Wood in court with Attorney Melissa M. Petersen appeared by video.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Mr. Wood appeared on 8/2 and was informed of charges and rights.  Defendant has no questions.  Attorney Petersen enters NGP and waiting to hear back on an offer.  NGP entered.  Mr. Wood may appear by zoom at his STC on 10/20.  Defendant confirms his address on file.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:57 PM Defendant Ricky J. Wood in court with Attorney Schroeder by video from SPD.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Mr. Wood needs to apply to SPD Office and is likely to qualify.  Defendant confirms his address on file.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

12:21 PM Defendant Ricky J. Wood appeared by video from the Pepin County Jail.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed charges in criminal complaint, penalties and rights and right to counsel.  Mr. Wood is local, State requests $2500 signature bond and no contact with TJD.  Mr. Wood confirms he knows who that person is and has no objection to bond requested by State.  Potential alcohol related and add no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entrance into bars or taverns .  Refrain from any contact in person or residence of TJD or where he or she works, no contact by electronic means or any other means or contact TJD on your behalf.  Refrain from possessing or consuming alcohol; no entry into bars or taverns except for purposes of employment.   Mr. Wood confirms his address on file.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
